00011 template<typename Score_T, typename Align_T> bool
00012 fine_tune_surfaces(ModelSitemap *model, const DbaseSitemap *dset,
00013                    Align_T *align, Score_T *score_method, 
00014                    const my_float_t min_delta = 1E-06,
00015                    const size_t max_iter=100, const bool verbose=false)
00016 {
00017   if(verbose) std::cout << "\n\n\n\n Inside fine tune align\n";
00018   const my_float_t RMSE_TOL = 0.05;
00019   my_float_t prev_RMSE = my_float_max;
00020   my_float_t* query_pts = 0, *db_pts = 0;
00021   size_t npts;
00022 
00023   // Save the initial alignment in the event we need to revert to it
00024   Align_T initial_align(*align);
00025 
00026   for(size_t n = 0; n < max_iter; ++n){
00027     // Get current correspondences
00028     align->score = score_method->score(*model, *dset, align);
00029     my_float_t RMSE = 
00030       score_method->correspondences(*model, &query_pts, &db_pts, &npts);
00031 
00032     if(RMSE <= RMSE_TOL) break;    
00033     if(prev_RMSE - RMSE < min_delta) break;
00034     prev_RMSE = RMSE;
00035 
00036     // We require at least 3 correspondences to fully describe a 3D alignment
00037     if(npts < 3){
00038       // Clean up mem
00039       if(query_pts) delete [] query_pts;
00040       if(db_pts) delete [] db_pts;
00041       query_pts = 0;
00042       db_pts = 0;
00043 
00044       return false;
00045     }
00046 
00047     // Get the transformation 
00048     Quaternion Q;
00049     my_float_t T[3];
00050     lse_3D_fit(query_pts, db_pts, npts, &Q, T);
00051   
00052     // Clean up mem
00053     if(query_pts) delete [] query_pts;
00054     if(db_pts) delete [] db_pts;
00055     query_pts = 0;
00056     db_pts = 0;
00057   
00058     // Apply the most recent transformation
00059     my_float_t R[9];
00060     Q.get_ortho_rot_mat(R);
00061   
00062     // This is a very inelegant solution, but we need to concentrate our
00063     // resources elsewhere at this point (rather than on numerics).
00064     // The main issue we have been facing is with a small number of points
00065     // 3  (the minimum required).  When we have a small number of points, 
00066     // sometimes too many of the corresponding points are the same;  in such 
00067     // a cases, the solution is degenerate and the roots of the characteristic
00068     // equation contain a complex component.
00069     if(std::isnan(T[0]) || std::isnan(T[1]) || std::isnan(T[2])){
00070        std::cout << "Fine tuning failed.\n"; 
00071        std::cout << "Number of pairs of corresponding points: "
00072                  << npts << "\n\n";
00073        *align = initial_align;
00074        return false;
00075     } 
00076 
00077     // Apply the transform
00078     model->inverse_transform(R, T, score_method->uses_surface_mesh(),
00079                              score_method->uses_hbond_surfaces());
00080 
00081   }
00082 
00083   // Get a single transformation that moves the dbase site to the query
00084 //  model->get_current_inverse_3D_transform(&(align->Q), align->T);
00085 //  align->Q.get_ortho_rot_mat(align->R);
00086 //  align->score = (align->score - A_mu) / A_sigma;
00087 
00088   return true;
00089 }
00090 
00091 template<typename Score_T, typename Align_T> bool
00092 fine_tune_caps_and_surf(ModelSitemap *model, const DbaseSitemap *dset,
00093                         Align_T *align, Score_T *score_method, 
00094                         const my_float_t surf_pt_W, const my_float_t hb_cap_W,
00095                         const my_float_t min_delta = 1E-06,
00096                         const size_t max_iter=100, const bool verbose=false)
00097 {
00098   if(verbose) std::cout << "\n\n\n\n Inside fine tune align\n";
00099   const my_float_t RMSE_TOL = 0.05;
00100   my_float_t prev_RMSE = my_float_max;
00101   my_float_t* query_pts = 0, *db_pts = 0, *q_polar_pts = 0, *db_polar_pts = 0;
00102   size_t npts, n_polar_pts;
00103 
00104   // Save the initial alignment in the event we need to revert to it
00105   Align_T initial_align(*align);
00106 
00107   for(size_t n = 0; n < max_iter; ++n){
00108 
00109     // Get current correspondences
00110     align->score = score_method->score(*model, *dset, align);
00111     score_method->correspondences(*model, &query_pts, &db_pts, &npts);
00112     score_method->polar_correspondences(*model, &q_polar_pts, &db_polar_pts,
00113                                         &n_polar_pts);
00114 
00115     size_t tot_npts = npts + n_polar_pts;
00116     my_float_t *q_pts = new my_float_t[6*tot_npts];
00117     my_float_t *d_pts = q_pts + 3*tot_npts;
00118 
00119     // Need to be careful with "zero" weights
00120     tot_npts = 0;
00121     if(surf_pt_W > 0){
00122       tot_npts = npts;
00123       std::copy(query_pts, query_pts + 3*npts, q_pts);
00124       std::copy(db_pts, db_pts + 3*npts, d_pts);
00125       if(hb_cap_W > 0){
00126         tot_npts += n_polar_pts;
00127         std::copy(q_polar_pts, q_polar_pts + 3*n_polar_pts, q_pts + 3*npts);
00128         std::copy(db_polar_pts, db_polar_pts + 3*n_polar_pts, d_pts + 3*npts);
00129       }
00130     }else if(hb_cap_W > 0){
00131       tot_npts = n_polar_pts;
00132       std::copy(q_polar_pts, q_polar_pts + 3*n_polar_pts, q_pts);
00133       std::copy(db_polar_pts, db_polar_pts + 3*n_polar_pts, d_pts);
00134     }
00135 
00136     Quaternion Q;
00137     my_float_t T[3];
00138     my_float_t RMSE = 0.0;
00139 
00140     // We require at least 3 correspondences to fully describe a 3D alignment
00141     if(tot_npts > 2){
00142       // Fill the weight vector if needed
00143       my_float_t *W = 0;
00144       if(surf_pt_W != hb_cap_W){
00145         W = new my_float_t[tot_npts];
00146         if(surf_pt_W > 0){
00147           std::fill(W, W + npts, surf_pt_W);
00148           if(hb_cap_W > 0) std::fill(W + npts, W + tot_npts, hb_cap_W);
00149         }else if(hb_cap_W > 0) std::fill(W, W + n_polar_pts, hb_cap_W);
00150       }
00151 
00152       // Compute the RMSE before computing the transform
00153       my_float_t *tmp = new my_float_t[3*tot_npts];
00154       vector(3*tot_npts, q_pts, db_pts, tmp);
00155       my_float_t N = 0.0;
00156       if(surf_pt_W != hb_cap_W){
00157         int cnt = 0;
00158         my_float_t *w = W;
00159         for(size_t i = 0; i < 3*tot_npts; ++i, ++cnt){
00160           RMSE += (*w) * tmp[i]*tmp[i];
00161           if(cnt >= 3){
00162             N += (*w);
00163             cnt = 0;
00164             ++w;    
00165           } 
00166         }
00167       }else{
00168         N = tot_npts;
00169         for(size_t i = 0; i < 3*tot_npts; ++i) RMSE += tmp[i]*tmp[i];
00170       }
00171       RMSE = std::sqrt(RMSE / N);
00172 
00173       if(tmp) delete[] tmp;
00174       tmp = 0;
00175 
00176       // see if this makes sense
00177       if(verbose) std::cout << "round " << n << " RMSD: " << RMSE << "\n";
00178       if(RMSE <= RMSE_TOL) break;    
00179       if(prev_RMSE - RMSE < min_delta) break;
00180       prev_RMSE = RMSE;
00181 
00182   
00183       // Get most recent transformation 
00184       lse_3D_fit(q_pts, d_pts, tot_npts, &Q, T, W);
00185       if(q_pts) delete [] q_pts;
00186       if(W) delete [] W;
00187       W = d_pts = q_pts = 0;
00188     }
00189 
00190     // Clean up mem
00191     if(query_pts) delete [] query_pts;
00192     if(db_pts) delete [] db_pts;
00193     if(q_polar_pts) delete [] q_polar_pts;
00194     if(db_polar_pts) delete [] db_polar_pts;
00195     query_pts = 0;
00196     db_pts = 0; 
00197     q_polar_pts = 0;
00198     db_polar_pts = 0;
00199 
00200     // We require at least 3 correspondences to fully describe a 3D alignment
00201     if(tot_npts < 3) return false;
00202 
00203     // Apply the most recent transformation
00204     my_float_t R[9];
00205     Q.get_ortho_rot_mat(R);
00206 
00207     // This is a very inelegant solution, but we need to concentrate our
00208     // resources elsewhere at this point (rather than on numerics).
00209     // The main issue we have been facing is with a small number of points
00210     // 3  (the minimum required).  When we have a small number of points, 
00211     // sometimes too many of the corresponding points are the same;  in such 
00212     // a cases, the solution is degenerate and the roots of the characteristic
00213     // equation contain a complex component.
00214     if(std::isnan(T[0]) || std::isnan(T[1]) || std::isnan(T[2])){
00215        std::cout << "Fine tuning failed.\n";
00216        std::cout << "Number of pairs of corresponding points: "
00217                  << npts << "\n\n";
00218        *align = initial_align;
00219        return false;
00220     }
00221 
00222     // Apply the transform
00223     model->inverse_transform(R, T, score_method->uses_surface_mesh(),
00224                              score_method->uses_hbond_surfaces());
00225       
00226   }
00227 
00228   // Get a single transformation that moves the dbase site to the query
00229 //  model->get_current_inverse_3D_transform(&(align->Q), align->T);
00230 //  align->Q.get_ortho_rot_mat(align->R);
00231 //  align->score = (align->score - A_mu) / A_sigma;
00232     
00233   return true;
00234 }
